byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Nicholas Fandos contributed reporting.

abstract: Supreme Court issues 5-to-4 decision cementing right to same-sex marriage in all states; Justice Anthony M Kennedy writes majority opinion saying all Americans are entitled to right to marry, while dissenting justices peg ruling as an affront to religious freedoms.
lead_paragraph: In a long-sought victory for the gay rights movement, the court ruled, 5-4, that the Constitution guarantees a right to same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Supreme Court Ruling Makes Same-Sex Marriage a Right Nationwide
headline.sub: A Pivotal Case After Decades of Activism

snippet: In a long-sought victory for the gay rights movement, the court ruled, 5-4, that the Constitution guarantees a right to same-sex marriage.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
